thread.title: Brandon Nett Joins Andersen Tax in Seattle as Commercial Managing Director

author: cnbc.com
title: Brandon Nett Joins Andersen Tax in Seattle as Commercial Managing Director
text:
SEATTLE--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Andersen Tax welcomes Brandon Nett as a Managing Director in the Seattle office and will join the firm’s Commercial Practice group. Brandon has extensive experience in consulting with clients on accounting for income taxes and other domestic and foreign tax matters. He has specific experience in mergers and acquisitions and has specialized tax experience in the technology, healthcare and mining industries.
“Brandon’s background in the technology and healthcare sectors will be a great asset to our firm, and his wealth of experience in all areas of the field such as acquisition structuring and consulting, cross-border transactions, and corporate spin-offs, will help us better compete in the market,” said Lance Lamprecht, Office Managing Director of the Seattle office. “I look forward to working with Brandon in our continued build-out of our Pacific Northwest Commercial Practice.”
Prior to Andersen Tax, Brandon was a Tax Partner at Grant Thornton in Seattle and led their West Region M&A tax services practice. Before Grant Thornton, he worked at PwC in Phoenix.
U.S. Country Managing Director of Andersen Tax LLC, Dan DePaoli, commented, “Brandon fills a significant need in the firm and his impressive experience complements our existing expertise and will enhance the development of our next generation of Commercial leaders. We are fortunate to have him on board.”
“With Brandon’s industry knowledge and deep expertise in tax controversies, divestitures, and tax integration, I am confident he will make significant contributions towards our clients in the region,” added Mark Vorsatz, Global Chairman and Andersen Tax LLC CEO. “He embodies the best-in-class client service that is central to our firm’s values and his leadership in the field will help strengthen our practice.”
Brandon received his Master of Taxation from Arizona State University and his Bachelor’s degree from University of Washington.
